New Records: Vangelis Pavlidis scored a brace, making history for Greece against England.
Key Match Events: Vangelis Pavlidis gave Greece the lead early in the second half.
Jude Bellingham equalized for England in the 87th minute.
Vangelis Pavlidis scored the winning goal in the fourth minute of stoppage time.
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley expressed hope to return as U21s coach if not offered the permanent job.
England started with an ultra-attacking lineup but misfired badly.
John Stones, captain in place of Harry Kane, commented on the disappointing result.
Post-Match Reflections: John Stones, England's captain, expressed disappointment with the result.
Lee Carsley, interim manager, may face diminished hopes of a permanent job after the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A minute's silence was held before kickoff for former international George Baldock who died recently.
The match was played at Wembley Stadium with an attendance of 79,012.
